alert.note: Alert for Yuma (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 08 at 5:23PM MDT until July 08 at 6:15PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Goodland has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Yuma County in northeastern Colorado... * Until 615 PM MDT. * At 523 PM MDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 4 miles northwest of Holyoke to 6 miles south of Paoli to 5 miles south of Highland Center, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. This storm has a history of producing golfball sized hail and 60 mph winds IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Wray. This includes Highway 385 between mile markers 241 and 270. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
